newsitem.title: EL SALVADOR: Three killed in soccer dispute in El Salvador.
newsitem.headline: Three killed in soccer dispute in El Salvador.

text.p: An argument following a local soccer match in El Salvador turned deadly when one of the players set off a hand grenade, killing two and injuring three, including himself, police said on Monday.
Tomas Ortiz, 18, and Francisco Ortiz, 45, died on Sunday from injuries sustained by the grenade blast, police said. The two were related but officials were unsure how.

Police said the grenade was triggered following the Sunday match by Concepcion Miranda, a former army soldier and member of the opposing team. Miranda, who was jailed pending charges, allegedly stole the grenade from an army armory.
The argument developed after a victory celebration by one of the teams, police said.
